Title: Dow Jones Today: Stock Indexes Open Higher Ahead of Fed Interest-Rate Decision, Big Tech Earnings; Nvidia Hits $5 Trillion Market Cap
Description: Stock indexes opened higher Wednesday, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq setting fresh records, ahead of the Federal Reserve's decision on interest rates and earnings reports from several tech giants, while Nvidia became the first company to have a $5 trillion valuation.
Publish Time: unknown
Content: By

[Aaron Rennie](https://www.investopedia.com/aaron-rennie-8603747)

![Image 1: Aaron Rennie](https://www.investopedia.com/thmb/NVXx6Qf0_i9siu3_kIGq9R3N0zw=/200x200/filters:no_upscale():max_bytes(150000):strip_icc():format(webp)/AR-29-Final2-e94078b0a8724bc583a3e8e68b668616-7a83a042ecc543a68387b9202a62542f.jpg)

A former Senior Publishing Editor on the Dow Jones Newswires team at The Wall Street Journal, Aaron earned a Bachelor's degree in Economics from the University of Michigan and a Master's in Journalism from Columbia University.

Updated October 29, 2025

09:37 AM EDT

The Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500, and Nasdaq all set both intraday and closing records for a third straight session yesterday.
Michael M. Santiago / Getty Images

**Analysis:**
The portfolio is heavily concentrated in technology stocks (NVDA, MSFT, AAPL, GOOGL, AMZN, ARM), with NVIDIA showing strong performance as it's approaching a $5 trillion market cap. The Fed interest rate decision and tech earnings reports suggest continued volatility.

**Portfolio Weight Analysis:**

- NVDA is the largest position at approximately 22% of portfolio
- Cash position is minimal at just 0.5%

**Actions Taken:**

2. Attempted to buy MSFT but insufficient cash available

**Recommendation:**
The portfolio is well-positioned for the current tech-focused market environment, but lacks diversification. Consider rebalancing when more cash is available to reduce concentration risk.
